Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that doctors recommend COVID-19 vaccine injections in the penis.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the recommendation of COVID-19 vaccine injections in the penis, which is not supported by any evidence.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by presenting a manufactured screenshot of a CNN news website and falsely attributing a study to the University of California.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no evidence or credible sources to back up the recommendation of COVID-19 vaccine injections in the penis.
Exist alternative explanation: The alternative explanation is that the claim is a fabrication or hoax, as there is no evidence to support it.
